meanings.definition: Resembling a tube in shape or structure.
meanings.sent1: The tubular toy was long and round.
meanings.sent2: The scientist studied the tubular plant under a microscope.
meanings.sent3: The tubular balloon floated gracefully in the sky.
meanings.sent4: Her tubular hairstyle reminded me of a spiral staircase.
meanings.sent5: The tubular cloud looked like a giant cotton candy in the sky.

meanings.definition: Of or relating to a tube.
meanings.sent1: The tubular design of the building allowed for easy airflow.
meanings.sent2: The plumber fixed the tubular pipe efficiently.
meanings.sent3: The tubular music echoed through the concert hall.
meanings.sent4: Her tubular necklace was made of silver tubes.
meanings.sent5: The tubular structure of the straw made it perfect for sipping.

meanings.sent3: The tubular of toothpaste was squeezed onto the brush.
meanings.sent4: The tubular of the telescope allowed for clear stargazing.
